document.docAuthor: Volynkin, Anton V. & László, Gyula M.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Afrasura Durante, 2009 from São Tomé Island with descriptions of a new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Afrasura Durante, 2009 from São Tomé Island with descriptions of a new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera: Erebidae: Arctiinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Miltochrista hieroglyphica Bethune-Baker, 1911
, The Annals and magazine of natural history (8) 7: 537 ( Type locality: [ Angola ] “N’Dalla Tando”).

=
Asura thomensis Rothschild, 1913
, Novitates Zoologicae 20 (1): 211 ( Type locality: “Island of St. Tomé, West Africa”), syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remark . In his revision of
Afrasura
species, Durante (2009) did not examine
Asura thomensis Rothschild, 1913
. The study of the genitalia of both sexes of this taxon demonstrated its conspecificity to
Afrasura hieroglyphica ( Bethune-Baker, 1911 )
, which is widespread in West Africa ( Figs. 21, 22 , 28, 29 ). Thus, the new synonymy is established here:
Afrasura hieroglyphica ( Bethune-Baker, 1911 )
=
Asura thomensis Rothschild, 1913
,
syn. nov.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 7–9 mm in males and 8–10 mm in females. Externally rather variable species: the width of transverse lines may widely vary within the same population.
A. hieroglyphica
differs clearly from the other two
Afrasura
species found on São Tomé Island by its external appearance and configuration of male and female genitalia. In the male genitalia, the bilobate distal saccular process is very characteristic for
A. hieroglyphica
.
Distribution . The species is known from the Republic of Guinea , Sierra leone , Liberia , Nigeria , Cameroon , Angola , Uganda ( Durante 2009 ), and São Tomé Island.
